title: The Long View  European Edition 2025
key_points: We believe the most powerful investment themes are rooted in rigorous analysis of the forces shaping an industry’s medium- and long-term evolution.

We think it is worthwhile for our analysts each year to ask: over the next five years, how could everything change? Given the rising threat from AI, we also think it is worthwhile for our analysts to learn a joke or two.

title: Digital Assets - The Rising Titans of the Blockchain Era
key_points: We believe the earnings tailwinds are sustainable, driven by regulatory tailwinds, not merely by crypto upside.
we believe the industry is fast getting derisked from any political regime shifts impacting its prospects.
We believe tokenization of real-world assets will unleash digital-native capital markets.
bull_case: tailwinds are sustainable, driven by regulatory tailwinds, not merely by crypto upside.
bear_case: risk framework and capital access make Strategy sustainable, the same may not hold true for many smaller companies attempting to replicate its strategy without comparable scale and risk management.
risked from any political regime shifts impacting its prospects.

title: Japan Returns Revolution
key_points: We believe that the value creation from these reforms will be more significant and sustainable than the basics pursued to date.

title: US Food - The Crucible of GLP-1 Drugs and MAHA
bear_case: headwinds, potential consolidation, and historical analyses to explore how the Recipe for Success has changed over the decades.

title: Deglobalization - Its a Big World After all
bear_case: risk of heretofore unanticipated cross-border frictions.

title: The Future of Tech
key_points: In summary, the future of technology will be characterized by rapid advancements across many sectors that promise to reshape industries and consumer interactions.

title: India Quick Commerce - Disrupting With Speed
bear_case: concerns the sustainability of cash burn as these companies scale.

title: Global Healthcare - GLP-1s Vs The Weight Of The World
key_points: we think the impact on dialysis players, Fresenius Medical Care and DaVita, is neutral over the next 5-10 years, but longer term we expect some headwinds.
predictions: will reach $95Bn (including survodutide) by 2030, with consensus estimating $94Bn (excluding survodutide).

title: Global Defense - International Growth in a Dangerous World
From Coin to Compute - The Bitcoin Investing Guide
key_points: We believe Bitcoin today signifies several intersecting trends — a digital asset hitting mainstream institutional adoption, Bitcoin’s evolving role in energy infrastructure, innovation in energy- efficient mining chip design, AI data center opportunities for Bitcoin miners, and leveraging Blockchain tech for financial innovation.
predictions: we expect Bitcoin to triple from here to attain a cycle- high price of $200K by 2025 end.

title: China 20 - Made In China Beyond 2025
key_points: We believe investors are best served through a selection of high-quality companies that are market leaders today and will remain so.
In summary, China’s future lies in a continued pivot to higher value-add segments and modernization of a wide range of manufacturing verticals.

title: Battery Utopia
key_points: We believe electric vehicles (EVs) will fully replace internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles over the coming decades.
predictions: will likely have the largest capacity in Europe by 2030.

title: Payments - The Money Machine
predictions: We forecast ~9-10% annual card purchase volume growth over the next five years, based on our in-depth industry model, where we look at card TAM by region/country.
We expect card penetration to approach ~74% by 2028.
bull_case: tailwinds, the sector is at a crossroads with regard to key questions such as: “How much secular growth runway remains?”, “Is TAM expansion into new flows real?”, “Are legitimate challengers to cards emerging?”, “Is regulation a real threat?”, and “Is the sector getting commoditized?”.
bear_case: risks remain contained for now, and the sector’s underlying revenue and profit pools are growing healthily.
risk to some legacy incumbents, but also an opportunity to expand TAM.

title: Japan - The Land of Rising Returns
key_points: we believe Japan is currently in a similar multi-year bull phase.
we believe the 2024 rally is likely to be led by large-caps.
bull_case: tailwinds, domestic Japan is where the impact of reflation would be most prominent — we urge global investors to look beyond the usual Japan names to find the hidden alpha opportunities.
